intro: Spigelia amplexicaulis, commonly known as the clasping spigelia, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that often wrap around the stem, giving it a unique appearance. Its flowering stems are typically erect and can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Spigelia amplexicaulis is often found in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in well-drained, acidic soils.
